reviews.text: Ta bien bueno el cafe
Absolute worst dining experience Iâ€™ve ever had. Classist and pretentious while the food is subpar cafeteria food.

I came here with my fiancÃ©e for our anniversary while visiting from London. The setting and view are stunning, and the food was excellent, though we were surprised to find it was a set menu at $195 per person. The hostesses were very welcoming and accommodating, which we appreciated.

However, our experience was let down by the behaviour of some of the waiters. I noticed a few of them laughing when I was taking photos of the view, something plenty of other guests were doing. In particular, the tall middle-aged waiter with glasses (mentioned in other reviews as well) seemed to mock us as he passed our table, which was uncomfortable and unprofessional.

It left us wondering whether this was just poor service or something more concerning. I think the restaurant could benefit from some staff training around professionalism and respect, especially given the fine-dining prices and reputation.
Everything was just perfect! Thank you for the delicious food and excellent service.
El sitio muy bonito y tenÃ­amos reserva , pero no nos dejaron entrar , nos trataron como a mendigos , tienes que ir de etiqueta . Nos miraron con mala cara y nos dijeron que nos fuÃ©ramos.

Are you looking for an elegant location in Brooklyn with a stunning view of Manhattan? This is your choice. The atmosphere is beautiful. The food on the menu is Michelin-star quality dishes. The River CafÃ© offers a dine-in experience or a dine-in experience for extravagant weddings. I recently had my sisterâ€™s wedding reception here and everything from the ceremony to the cake cutting was handled with care. It was a top-notch experience. The staff were very polite. The prices were high, and the high costs will bring you top-quality service and Michelin-starred dishes. I highly recommend you try this restaurant out.

This is a hard review to leave, so will start with the positives.
The views looking back at NYC are lovely.
The food was ok.  Hard being a vegetarian with allergies (although, gave heaps of notice).
The staff needed to smile (only one managed this).  Especially the host that greeted us, he came across as rude and cold.
The cafe style cane chairs weren't comfortable and a little out of place to rest of the restaurant atmosphere.
It was summer when we went and the air con was extremely cold but I guess this was to cater for the males having to wear a jacket (at all times).
If you are staying in NYC you will have to organise transport (we allowed 45mins).
This is a very expensive restaurant that left no memorable impression.  Definitely not worth the money.
And ladies if you are going here, even in summer - bring your jacket just in case.
We had also requested a window table since we were coming from Australia for a special birthday - we did not get that.
å¥½å‹å¥³å„¿åœ¨è¿™é‡Œä¸¾åŠå©šç¤¼ï¼Œæ•ˆæœéå¸¸å¥½ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

We had the pleasure of celebrating our wedding anniversary and birthday at your restaurant, and it was an exceptional experience. The atmosphere was elegant and serene, with a breathtaking view of the sunset that created the perfect settingâ€¦

Definitely not worth it. I was very disappointed in this experience especially considering the steep price tag. The best part of going here was the entrance autumn decor and the sunset drive over Brooklyn bridge. We were seated at a rubbish table even though I had booked back in February and the restaurant wasn't fill at the time of reservation. So we had a horrible view of the back wall and the service station (I saw they did this to numerous young couples). If you have a yearning for the "experience" I would recommend you stop by the outside to take in the views of the exterior decorations and maybe pop in for a glass of wine at the bar, and then take yourself elsewhere for a decent meal and good service. Service is just meh, the food is not memorable or particularly well executed. The duck was very tender and so was the octopus. But the dishes as a whole were not tasty or good quality. The souffle was curdled and had scrambled eggs vibes and the cheap chocolate used on the bridge dessert made it pretty awful.
Great date night, great food, top service and great music

Incredible location and view on a clear night. There for a birthday and seemingly the whole staff knew, that was a nice touch.

Food was incredible, certainly an experience to remember and return to.
Nada grato el cÃ³digo de vestimenta, caray estamos en 2025
KÃ¶prÃ¼nÃ¼n manzarasÄ±yla mekan birleÅŸmiÅŸ yemekler Ã§ok lezzetli atmosfer Ã§ok gÃ¼zel New Yorkâ€™a gelip de buraya uÄŸramadan dÃ¶nmeyin
highly recommended ,

this place is unbeatable. the food, views, service are all top notch. we loved it so much that we got married here and it was such an incredible day. i would highly recommend it for any special event - alyson and her team really delivered on every detail

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
Absolutely delighted!
Iâ€™m truly impressed â€” The River lives up perfectly to its reputation. Itâ€™s the ideal restaurant for celebrating any special occasion or simply indulging in a true gastronomic journey. You wonâ€™t find this level of quality in American cuisine anywhere else. Everything is flawless â€” from the moment you step inside to the very end of your visit.
The view, the atmosphere, the service â€” all deserve a solid 10/10.

A great dining experience, with a very friendly and attentive staff. The food is rich, fresh and delicious. Great views of the east River, Brooklyn bridge and the freedom tower. The restaurant is extremely expensive, my wife and I spent $750 for a dinner for two.

An unforgettable anniversary dinner at The River CafÃ© stunning views, impeccable service, and exquisite attention to detail in every dish. The food was pure art, perfectly balancing flavor and presentation. The evening ended beautifully with a bridge-shaped cake wishing us a happy anniversary. A thoughtful touch that made the night truly special. ğŸŒ‰âœ¨

A wonderful experience. The View, the service and the live Piano on a vintage Steinway sons set the scene for an epic New York city dining experience. The food was great and It was peaceful and not too crowded which was perfect.

This was my first time here and With a lot of expectation On $100 for parking they couldnâ€™t help me with the reservation. They ordered money for everything so just get a very negative image about this restaurant and I will not recommend this to anybody. Even the lady at the front desk seemed very non-receptive when I called her to inform her. This is the stuff thatâ€™s going on so somebody needs to hold these people accountable.

The stuff is the problem., fist once you walk into the restaurant they overlook you up and down
They behave like security guards they just make you feel uncomfortable in my opinion this overrated

I had an amazing birthday here. The service and food were amazing. The drinks were prefect. They made me feel like I was the only one there. The steak with the bone marrow had me wanting seconds. Don't forget the brandy flight they were so smooth and flavorful even if you're not a brandy person you will enjoy
Fantastic views. The food doesn't quite meet my standards, but that's okay.

Excellenter Service (egal ob Kellner, Maitre, Somelier etc.)  Sehr gute Essensauswahl und kÃ¶stlich. Sensationeller Ausblick.
Absolut empfehlenswert und jeden Dollar wert.

This American restaurant offers a remarkable view of the New York City skyline, arguably among the finest. It provides an exceptional fine dining experience in New York, distinguished by its quality. The cocktail bar in Brooklyn is, without question, a premier destination.

I found a HairğŸ’‡ in my food, on top of my shrimp. It grossed me out.
I didnâ€™t think I got a picture, but I posted a photo of the 2nd course on instagram and by chance got a photo. Pretty unsanitary because it looked like a pubic hair to me. Donâ€™t go here unless you want to experience a dirty place, with dirty food, and pour customer service!!!!  Im appalled.
See photo for proof. Manager offered a glass of a cheap glass of wine as a solutionâ€¦ treated me like I made it all up. I understand some people do things like that, but.. come on. My wife was wearing at least 100k in jewelry.
The Bald manager was rude and tried to ruin the night, I didnt even ask for him, the waiter called him over.
I dont have time to talk to management. Do the right thing and treat people right, and dont make me waste my time speaking to you about your mistakes.  Im out to enjoy myself, not deal with your restaurants incompetence.ğŸ’¯ I will not be back and suggest anyone readying this find another spot that isnt played out and old.ğŸ’½
The food is just out of this world, so amazing. The service is just as fantastic, the team is so attentive. This space is absolutely stunning.

We were expecting a wonderful evening, but unfortunately we left feeling rather disappointed.

When we made the reservation, we specifically asked for a front-row table. We were told that reservations for those tables were not possible. However, when we arrived very early, we noticed that two front-row tables were available. When we asked to be seated there, we were told, â€œSorry, but those tables are reserved.â€

The food, in all honesty, did not live up to the price. We understand that part of the cost reflects the beautiful view, but even taking that into account, the quality was not satisfactory. Moreover, my wife felt unwell after the meal.

The overall atmosphere did not reflect the standards of a fine restaurant: the environment was noisy, with many shouting customers, and the venue itself appeared somewhat outdated and in need of renovation.

On a positive note, the view was truly stunning, and the staffâ€™s kindness was greatly appreciated. However, the inconsistency regarding table reservationsâ€”being told it was impossible for us, yet seemingly available to othersâ€”was disappointing and frankly unacceptable.

I dined here recently. To summarize, the staff is so stuck up and uninviting, seems like they easily discriminate by your skin color. Although I shouldâ€™ve listened to peopleâ€™s experiences; the quality of the food just went down. Iâ€™ve also heard they have a rat problem? How is this acceptable for a fine dining restaurant?
Hollywood Smile Photo Booth review. Gorgeous restaurant at the amazing location with the view of our most wonderful city. Photo Booth was a great addition to the wedding reception
Beautiful setting and tastefully done

This is an experience to be had for sure! The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was everything you would expect being located right across the river from Manhattan. Needless to say, the prices were not for the "faint of heart..."
If I had to make an observation, it did seem that while the staff was extremely polite, I sensed a little bit of a "robotic" way of doing things. It's not criticism but I suspect with all the favorable comments they receive, they go with the attitude "if it's not broke don't fix it."
Did I also mention, the evening view of the Brooklyn Bridge outside the restaurant is literally breathtaking!
Epic experience with a great view of Brooklyn bridge and manhattan with the water! Employees are very professional and knowledgeable about their work! Onsite parking experience amazed me! Posh vibe..
A definite experience. Service and good were exceptional. Loved being on the river and the garden was well planted.
Nicest place that weâ€™ve ever been. Thank you all

âœ¨Lovely & Romantic Evening at The River CafÃ© âœ¨
We had the most wonderful experience here. From the moment we arrived, the warm welcome set the tone for the evening.
The atmosphere was romantic, with stunning views to New York landscape that made everything feel extra special.

The service was attentive and professional, making us feel truly taken care of.

Every momentâ€”from the start to when we leftâ€”was enjoyable, and itâ€™s clear that this is a place where both the food and the experience matter. A truly memorable evening! ğŸŒ¹ğŸ‚

This is actually my dream place and my boyfriend brought me to here for his birthday treat. We booked the reservation and the formal attire is mandatory. The view is amazing and foods are really delicious especially try the duckâ€™s liver and chocolate Brooklyn bridge dessert. I have one problem with the seating, please take a look at my first photo. Do I even look like I am dining in michellin stars fine dining restaurant? Service is great except the guy who took responsible for seats. He has a bit of attitude on his face since we are asians and I felt discrimination for first time in fine dining restaurant. He is old, tall, wore glasses and wearing long black coat. There are plenty of seats available(nobody come to sit at there until we are done with our dinner) and he is not willing to change the seats for us(especially he doesnâ€™t even say sorry, he shrinks his face like he felt bothered by us and use high tone of voice). I mean what a great customer service for almost $500 dinner. Other servers and waiters were very helpful and friendly. Only that guys has a problem and he deserves to get fired ğŸ™‚â€â†•ï¸ He literally destroyed my photography girly dream!!!!
Great restaurant. As beautiful as it looks in the pictures. Good food. Service by blonde woman and the sommelier were apathetic. Could benefit from a touch more engagement and hospitality

We celebrated our 54th wedding anniversary on Thursday. What a fabulous experience, from the moment we arrived to our exit. The elegance of the establishment is equivalent and worthy of the indulgent cost. We were warmly greeted by staff. The views were spectacular. The food delectable.
Superb in all details!
recommended
the views are AMAZING good for a dinner date night
Way overpriced, over rated, snobby.   Find a family friendly restaurant or nice steakhouse.  If itâ€™s the view you want, take the ferry to DUMBO and walk around.
$650 for 2 people includes 3 course set menu and 2 drinks per person. Worth every dollar. Ambiance, service, food, amazing.  Set expectations to spend money but itâ€™s a memory-worthy experience!
Wonderful experience!
Service was amazing! Excellent views! Duck was to die for! Definitely recommend for couples and special family events!
Unrivaled in service, quality and innovation; making your dinner experience memorable for a lifetime.

We had incredibly high expectations given the Michelin star, reputation, price and location. While we didnâ€™t have a terrible experience we were also not at all impressed. The ambience felt stiff and stuffy. The food, while not awful, also was pretty average. We were seated so close to the couple next to us that we overheard every part of their conversation (and they heard ours) and my leg touched hers the majority of the night. For a restaurant of this â€˜caliberâ€™ (ğŸ™„) we shouldnâ€™t be packed like sardines able to be a part of conversations of other guests.
*we visited in March 2022.

Sooooo romantic, best romantic restaurant in the city!! I recommend this place to couple!! Maybe, You will imagine that this situation is prepared event only for me!!

We visited The River CafÃ© over the holidays with high expectations, especially considering it has been, and still is, regarded as the most exclusive fine dining American restaurant on the water in NYC since 1977. Unfortunately, the experience fell far short of what one would expect from such a prestigious establishment.

From the moment we arrived, the service felt cold and uninviting. There was a noticeable lack of warmth and attentivenessâ€”it genuinely felt as though we werenâ€™t treated like guests. The level of hospitality simply didnâ€™t match the reputation the restaurant carries.

The food was also underwhelming. For a place with such a longstanding legacy, I expected a memorable and refined culinary experience. Instead, the dishes lacked flavor, creativity, and finesse. For the price, itâ€™s simply not the most worthwhile food in New York there are plenty of other restaurants in the city offering far better meals at a similar or even lower cost.

The only highlight of the evening was the ambiance the view of the Brooklyn Bridge is undeniably beautiful and adds charm to the setting. Sadly, that was the only part of the evening that lived up to the restaurantâ€™s reputation.

Overall, what should have been a festive and elevated dining experience turned out to be a major letdown. For a restaurant that claims such exclusivity and history, it simply didnâ€™t deliver on food, service, or value

My husband and I came here for to celebrate our one year of marriage. The staff were very attentive and the waitress was kind enough to take photos of us. The view is gorgeous and the food was amazing. The salmon melts in your mouth!! Thank you River Cafe for making our evening so special

Best Michelin-star restaurant for me! Had great experience with all food we got and drinks. Only I donâ€™t like they give us kind of old jacket for man to wear. I understand dress code rules but itâ€™s kind of not pleasant to wear something after other people. But even with this rule food experience was amazing for us!

Thoroughly enjoyed our experience at River Cafe last night. The floral grounds (in Aug) were beautiful & really draws you in. The staff was welcoming & very professional. The bartender crafted 2 cocktails for us that werenâ€™t on the menu & they were delicious. Just ask. The food â€¦ was exceptional. Chef Brad really knows how to elevate a dish. We enjoyed several appetizers, the sea bass & duck and also dessert. The sommelier really listened & suggested a bottle that perfectly complemented our meal. Everything was beyond our expectations. Easily the best meal weâ€™ve ever experienced. Highly recommend.

Under the Brooklyn Bridge.  Stunning views. We visited some time ago, I just havenâ€™t had the chance to review.  Our friends were moving to Upstate NY and have been wanting to visit the upscale restaurant.   The service, atmosphere & food is five 5.  We had reservations.  Party of 5.  We would have loved a window table .  However, they did not accommodate.  You can see the lovely view no matter where youâ€™re seated.   Piano singer which was lovely.  Coat check.  Itâ€™s a great â€œoccasionâ€ restaurant.  $$$$ High We spent over $1500.00 plus tip.  It was worth it for us.
I regret not taking more pics.
A vegetarian menu.  I had the Mushroom Wellington which was fabulous !

This was my second time celebrating my birthday at The River CafÃ©. It became a favorite after my first visit, but sadly, this time didnâ€™t quite measure up. The service was unusually slow and not as attentive as expected. After we finished dinner, it took over 20 minutes for our dessert to arriveâ€”meanwhile, guests who were seated after us were served and had even left before we were done, which was pretty disappointing. Iâ€™d also heard there was an Ã  la carte menu available, but we were only offered the prix fixeâ€”decent, but it wouldâ€™ve been nice to have more options. Still, the beautiful view and the ambiance, especially the live piano music, continue to make the setting feel magical and memorable.

The view of the East River is the Star â­ï¸.   Valet Parking.   Nice Staff.   Pre Fix Menu only.   Pick one appetizer, entree, and dessert ğŸ¨.   Caviar option for an additional fee.  Food is good.    Reservations must be made with a credit card ğŸ’³.  On the more expensive side compared to other Michelin Star â­ï¸ restaurants.   Card payments are accepted.   Clean facilities.   Good for a celebratory dinner.   We will definitely be going back.

Food is really good and the location is perfect for a wedding. Servers need to NOT walk across the dance floor in the middle of first bride and groom dance, father daughter dance and mother son dance!!!! Why would they do that??! Venue is hard to deal with. Multiple surprises in the week before the wedding. Was told if there is a tent stood up by another event early afternoon prior to the wedding, they don't have time to take it down so the wedding will have to sucks the sucks to keep the tent, rain or shine!! This venue restricts to a short list of DJs and florists whether you like them or not!! The DJ backed out because he claims his flight has to be delayed and can't come back in time. Well, it sounded like we have never traveled internationally to have to believe that! No bride and groom should have to be strssed with their last minute surprises, attitude and insensitivity! They really shouldn't think they are sitting in a pot of gold. This is a nice place for occasions but for weddings, you really need to understand what you are getting into because they require 50% down when you book which can be 1.5 years in advance.

I was here on 8/14 and had a beautiful time.
The service is outstanding. Alex and the rest of crew took really great care of us. I love the dress code, everyone looked very elegant.
Food was good. And they have parking ğŸ˜
Overall it was great experience. Iâ€™ll definitely go back again.

Thereâ€™s a stiffness to this place that I canâ€™t quite describe. Itâ€™s this space with amazing views but where youâ€™re expected to be on your best behaviour lest the old money prancing around the room feels offended. The food was alright, but definitely not worth the prix fixe they charge. There was also nothing wrong with the way we were treated throughout the night - Iâ€™d put it as courteous but curt - and yet it felt cold and uninviting.

It might just be that I had unfair expectations of this place, so take my review with grain of salt. But to me, for the price point, it felt very much average. Take it somewhere like Manhatta for a much nicer experience.

The River CafÃ© is truly an iconic and magical place! I celebrated my birthday here with my boyfriend, and we arrived beyond hungry. We ordered three prix-fixe menus, and the dishes were served evenly and elegantlyâ€”almost like we got an extra appetizer and entrÃ©e because of our extra order. Every plate was beautifully presented and packed with incredible flavors.

The atmosphere was simply amazing, making the entire dining experience feel special. Although I was a little disappointed that we werenâ€™t seated right by the window, everything else exceeded my expectations. The service was impeccable, and the overall experience was unforgettable. Highly recommend for a special occasion!

this place was lovely the food was just as amazing as the ambiance! the view is beautiful during sunset & the staff is very professional, kind, attentive & wonderful. the food was delicious iâ€™m allergic to shellfish they gave me options that were free of any fish they were all truly delicious. the chocolate cake was amazing as well as the cheesecake. this was a great experience for my birthday thank you to the staff & compliments to the chef it exceeded our expectations!

Para empezar tenÃ­amos la reserva desde hace un mes y el mismo dÃ­a de la reserva me llega un correo de que la reserva se ha cancelado â€¦. Cuando llamo al restaurante me dice que no he respondido al telÃ©fono el dÃ­a anterior y que por eso se me ha cancelado, les digo que soy de EspaÃ±a y que mi nÃºmero no estÃ¡ operativo ahÃ­ que solo dispongo de WhatsApp a lo que me dicen que es su protocolo pero que van a ver si me pueden hacer un hueco â€¦. Finalmente me dicen que si â€¦. Cuando llegamos la mesa ya no era la que yo habÃ­a pedido al lado de la ventana sino al fondo â€¦. AÃºn sabiendo que era una ocasiÃ³n especial les dio igual â€¦.
Ãbamos vestidos super elegantes yo con un vestido corto negro y tacones y mi marido con un traje completo negro .. ese dÃ­a hizo bastante calor 28 grados y la noche era calurosa en el restaurante la verdad que hacÃ­a calor â€¦. Un trato que deja mucho que desear por no decir que los camareros era todos unos bordes que he contestaban con monosÃ­labos

Great atmosphere, the food was really good, but you need to enjoy a bit of spiceâ€”but thatâ€™s part of the specialty. Beautiful view from the restaurant. But not much choice when it comes to desserts.
As wonderful as you would expect. Excellent service, great food, and an unbeatable view. Honestly not that bad price-wise for a Michelin star either.

We captured photo and video for a truly gorgeous wedding here, and just adore this venue and their wonderful staff! The food is just out of this world, so so amazing. The service is just as fantastic, the team is so attentive of each guests and the couple, and weâ€™re very communicative with us as the documentation team. This space is absolutely stunning, our couple had their ceremony on the terrace and it was the most gorgeous, intimate scene for their â€œI Doâ€™sâ€.

Destiny & Alyson were our contacts for day of coordination with the venue and they were lovely to work with as well!

Me and my husband discovered this restaurant a few years ago, in winter, and promised ourselves to come back in the summer to enjoy a dinner on the terrace overlooking the Brooklyn Bridge. For this reason, we made a reservation over a month in advance, clearly requesting a table with a view. We were surprised to learn that, despite the early booking, they couldnâ€™t guarantee itâ€”clearly poor organization.
A few days before our visit, they contacted us to reconfirm the reservation. We reiterated that it was a special occasion and that the view was very important to us. They replied that they would do their best.
Upon arrival, the manager informed us that no table with a view was available. We explained that we had come all the way from Italy specifically for this experience and were willing to wait, even for a long time. In a rather unwelcoming tone, he said the wait could be up to 50 minutesâ€”clearly trying to discourage us. We decided to stay anyway, ordered a drink at the bar, and asked if we could take it out to the terrace to enjoy the sunset and take a few photos. The bartender was very kind and said it was fine. But as we approached the terrace, the manager abruptly stopped us, saying there was a private event.
We explained we just wanted a couple of minutes for photos and would finish the drink elsewhere if needed, but he remained firm. We pointed out that, had we known certain areas were unavailable, we would have chosen a different night. After all, we were paying for the full experience, not just a limited part of the venue.
At that pointâ€”almost as if to appease our disappointmentâ€”a dinner table suddenly became available. But the atmosphere had already been ruined.
Despite the beauty of the place, we do not recommend this restaurant, especially due to the way we were treated. The service does not live up to the high prices.

maybe itâ€™s because im gen z but the food was whatever. Iâ€™ve never gone back thinking mmmm i need glorified cat food or anything i ate for that matter. I do however respect the effort and art of it. Its definitely a one and done thing for me. anyway super cute for a date night for the small price of 700+

Simply spectacular. The service, from the entrance by the valet parking staff, the reception, the sommelier, Steve, the waiters and the rest of the restaurant staff who served us was exceptional.

My wife and I went to celebrate our anniversary, like other couples, and they seated us at the window to contemplate the spectacular view of the East River.
I highly recommend the cocktail 77. The rabbit and the duck were delicious, not to mention the chocolate Brooklyn dessert, accompanied by a good coffee to finish.

An experience with an unconventional view and an excellent place for a special occasion, especially if it is with the person you love.

Thanks again to The River CafÃ© for making our anniversary feel more pleasant.
Awesome spot for dinner! No way they shouldnâ€™t still have a Michelin star. Great atmosphere and views!

Found a last minute reservation for a table of four to celebrate a birthday and it did not disappoint. Everything was spectacular from the service to the food to the music. The history and charm of the establishment is delicately spoken throughout the interior and the staff are very professional. The menu is prefixed at $195 per person before taxes and tips. With drinks, it is about $250 per person. The food was meticulously well presented and tasted wonderful. The atmosphere is elegant and it is not loud at all to have a conversation. The dress code is consistently enforced, so be prepared.

Advice: the waitstaff responsible for clearing the plates and the table can use help for larger tables of four. When there was only one waitstaff available to clear the table, he resorted to clearing the table in between two guests, on the right side and the left side of one and the other guest, instead of taking the time to clear away from the guest rather in front of the guest. This caused a steak knife to come centimeters away from grazing one of the guestâ€™s eyes as he was clearing the plates.

Our experience at The River CafÃ© was absolutely wonderful. The staff was warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere was elegant yet inviting. While they do have a dress code, it added to the upscale feel of the evening and wasnâ€™t an issue for us. The food was exceptionalâ€”every dish was flavorful, and the meat was cooked to perfection. To top it off, the breathtaking view made the evening even more memorable. It was the perfect choice for celebrating our anniversary.

The food is without a doubt the best Iâ€™ve ever had.  Fresh, flavorful, with incredible attention to detail.  The cocktails are a similar story; the perfect old fashioned and Manhattan.  But the service is what makes the whole experience from the very moment you enter to when you leave.

My meal was entirely vegan! I had the mushroom Wellington and the chocolate cake.

My omnivore partner had the sea bass - they werenâ€™t the biggest fan but thought everything was delicious!

I think this place is amazing for special occasions - the service and food are fantastic! The views are nice!

An unforgettable birthday celebration for my husband! letâ€™s face it- ya gotta celebrate The Huz! And he deserves it and then some. From the moment we arrived at The River CafÃ©, we were treated with the utmost care and attention. The entire experience felt elevated and elegant, from the exquisite menus to the beautifully curated bar area.The food was executed to perfection, every plate was a surprise, dining here is an experience for sure, but it was the impeccable, white-glove service that truly set the evening apart. My husband called it the best birthday heâ€™s ever hadâ€”and I took him to Puerto Rico last year! A truly stunning experience weâ€™ll cherish forever.
